bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John A. Halderman (1833-1908), originally from Fayette Co., Kentucky, was a lawyer and judge in Leavenworth Co., Kansas. He served as major general of the northern division of Kansas state troops during the Civil War. He also served as mayor of Leavenworth, and in the Kansas state legislature. In the 1880s, he was stationed as consul-general and minister-resident in Bangkok; he returned to Washington D.C. in the early 1900s and died in Atlantic City, New Jersey.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of miscellaneous correspondence, primarily dating from the 1880s while Halderman was in the diplomatic service of the United States. A variety of matters are discussed, but content is largely personal with little mention of Halderman's diplomatic work. Correspondence is comprised of invitations, requests for consort's cards, and introductions. There are a few Civil War letters and an 1857 letter concerning a legal matter. Correspondents include congressmen, authors, and diplomats.
